sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: A section of the Cantor set is taken such that it consists of the first 4 iterations of the construction process. Find the length of this section assuming the original line segment had a length of 1 unit.
message_2:
The Cantor set is constructed by iteratively removing the middle third of each line segment. Let's find the length of the section after each iteration:

1. Original line segment: 1 unit
2. After 1st iteration: 1 - 1/3 = 2/3 units (two segments of 1/3 each)
3. After 2nd iteration: (2/3) - (2/9) = 4/9 units (four segments of 1/9 each)
4. After 3rd iteration: (4/9) - (4/27) = 8/27 units (eight segments of 1/27 each)
5. After 4th iteration: (8/27) - (8/81) = 16/81 units (sixteen segments of 1/81 each)

So, the length of the section after the first 4 iterations is 16/81 units.
